job_title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room in Cooperstown, NY
pros: Had a lot of great coworkers in my department. The other nurses in the department were very helpful and kind, the doctors were top notch as well. Very approachable and open.
cons: Management doesn’t care about you or keep their word. Lots of sketchy behind the scenes stuff happens, the good people are pushed out of the company. Get paid less than you’re worth, and every day get asked to pick up extra. Also guilted into working more “for the good of our patients.”

job_title: Staff RN Ll in Milford, NY
pros: Some very good people, but not enough to make you want to stay, well intentioned best practices but not enough resources to be effective. Leadership is transactional not transformational. They pay ridiculous sums to make up for the lack of staff- if you are an overtime hoarder this is your place.
cons: Extremely high turnover, low pay, poor morale, so-called leadership is apathetic, no effort at improvement, innovation or change. Inappropriate and unprofessional behaviors are tolerated. A pervasive lack of accountability, gossiping and cliquish staff, a generally inhospitable environment.

job_title: Various Positions Held in Cooperstown, NY
pros: Large employee in an area with few year round full time jobs, many places you can transfer once you're in. If you pay a lot of attention to the leader you'll be under you can do well but change is constant too.
cons: Bassett sees general employees and even patients as expendable, there is a line of people who want in so there is no reason to try to help the lower level employees. There is no accountability for management even if they're doing something illegal they just give them a new position in a different facility. No matter what department you work in it's rarely set up to benefit the patient truly. I'm aware it's a for profit but it should not take patients 6 phone calls to 3 departments to get a script refilled, you should not be looking at icu patients to determine which MIGHT be ok in a Lower level of care so you can give the bed to someone else for their revenue instead of sending the second patient elsewhere.

pros: I really can't think of any, except I work in the OR Services and there are a handful of people that are descent, compassionate, caring. The rest aren't. Anesthesia people are great.
cons: The Clowns at Bassett Medical decided after number of years with no pay raise. That we are at the current market value. I'm sorry I miss spoke not clowns the CEOs at Bassett. This just adds to me wanting to get out of here. I can't believe it. How many bonuses are they going to get for this stiff screw to the employees. This hospital needs a UNION NOW. The Rich get richer and the people that actually work rather than go and sit in meetings get a raise or bonuses. There is something wrong.  I got a breakfast sandwich for RN week. I took one bite a day to savor all that free flavor for the week. This hospital is miserly, uncostly, easy on their pocket book, market down, cut rate, cheapo outfit, cost next to nothing, employee depreciating, nominal pay,  tightwad, pennypincher, SCROOGE,  skinflint, and not least or last, they are A PIKER. They don't appreciate the employees that make the money for them. I usually don't rant, but this is a punch in the gut.

job_title: Staff RN in New York, NY
pros: M-F  8-5 (usually)  good benefits
cons: Management, especially in the clinics is horrible.  No one seemed to know what they're doing and they don't agree on anything.  We had 2 managers and a supervisor but not enough staff that actually take care of patients.  We were always short staffed and I felt terrible for our patients.   A nurse would get sent to another clinic only for a second nurse to get sent to a different clinic.  Nothing made any sense and I'm so glad I left.  I now have management I respect that care and listen.  It makes all of the difference in the world.  I've decided to post on every place I can so that nurses know there are much better options out there.

review_title: Great opportunity to learn new skills, but no career path and upper management cares only for themselves.
pros: Benefits are good when they are not cut (such as the recent suspension of 403(b) contributions). Staff at the lowest levels are friendly and caring for the most part. Willing to help out their fellow employees and patients alike.
cons: Senior management will insist on cutting things like 403(b) contributions, annual raises (which are below inflation in the best of times) and other things yet waste money on their own pet projects without blinking. Decisions are almost always made with internal politics in mind without regard for the greater impact on patient care nor employee satisfaction/moral.

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Middleburgh, NY
pros:
Treat Students during the school day.
Middleburgh School was/ is an excellent school site in relation to students, families, and faculty.
Free to exercise Professional Judgment within the context of the school system.  Highly respected and welcomed with open minds and interest.
cons: Bassett as an organization that is actually a Hospital in Cooperstown, NY; doesn't provide adequate support and are disconnected with their employees at the school sites.  Upon their infrequent visits; the organization overly presumes the parameters and individual client needs.  Poor organization for support.  The main purpose is to provide the possibility for Licensed Clinical Social Workers a venue to practice their skills.

pros: There are numerous educational and growth opportunities offered.
cons: Some highly desired posted jobs aren't posted long enough before an offer is given to someone. I thought postings were supposed to be up for 2 weeks at least before offering a position to someone, which would allow a good pool of applicants (and might have allowed me to have a dream position). On the other hand, some positions are so competitive that they are left open too long, resulting in a larger pool of desirable applicants and having to wait to hear stretching on for months.

pros: The Cooperstown hospital is located in a pretty location, with friendly co-workers and staff that share a family vibe.  Highly recommended if you can get in!
cons: Because of the rural setting, you will probably get to know several ignorant  co-workers who endlessly badmouth anyone who is of different color, nationality or sexual preference.   Plus, a large majority of employees are overweight and (of course), it's not their fault.  Thankfully, the more education the employee has, the less they tend to behave like this.

job_title: Security Team Lead in Cooperstown, NY
pros: Excellent pay and benefits. Great people to work with throughout the hospital.
cons: High turnover in many departments. Favoritism of certain employees. Mandated meetings on days off.

pros:
The people in my immediate department were  great to work with. They were very supportive, caring and genuine. People are there because the truly believe in providing the best of service to our community and patients. 

Some of the leadership was very active and engaged with the employees. Benefits such as health, dental etc were great! Retirement could use some work. You have to wait two years before the company starts contributing to your retirement. You can make personal contributions right when you start.
cons: Hard to move up internally. Process of applying, interviewing and waiting for a response from HR would take a long time.

pros: Great Human Resources and Payroll Departments.  Most issues are dealt with that same day.  Upper management does try to inform all employees on the organizations current standings and issues.  Free coffee after hours.
cons: Very little follow up is given, among coworkers and management alike, unless it's negative.  Salaried workers are expected to take working lunches and no breaks.  Commitment to your Coworker Policy is often overlooked.

review_title: Good people, horrid culture and upper management.
pros: Good fellow employees. Fair benefits
cons: Very top heavy with management, not enough people to really do the work. Upper management always seemed to have solutions to problems that didn't exist and ignored actual problems. Benefits were getting worse over time. Top levels ignored any input from people actually doing the work. Pay was well below market.

review_title: Terrible place to work due punitive culture
pros: Good workers who generally care for patients. Good benefits.Nice setting in Cooperstown. Several Different facilities to work out. Outreach tends to be less stressful
cons: No room so those needing offices don't have them. Professionals who handle confidential information are placed in cubicles. The culture is highly punitive. Senior Management completely disconnected from staff and staff needs.

review_title: My experience with Bassett Healthcare was atypical because I was overqualified and, at times, misunderstood.
job_title: School Based Therapist, LCSWR in Cooperstown, NY
pros:
Despite my poor experience with Bassett as an organization; I support the Global Approach and outreach Bassett is providing areas of need that would otherwise go unnoticed.  They have a progressive, yet credible approach in health care. Based on this employee's observations; Bassett Healthcare has some exceptional Administrative and Directive role models that support others in creativity, inspiration and motivation to offer exceptional quality care.  This employee believes that it is imperative that some important names support the previous statement.  Jane Hamilton, who started as a Registered Nurse; evolved into a mover, shaker and visionary of School Based Health.  Dr. Koljhede (forgive the spelling), offers an equal, yet different role in the School Based Administration.  Dr. K. and Jane Hamilton walked and talked in the same manner.  They did not offer unrealistic jargon; rather they both possessed vision and practice in a passionate manner for others to carry out the dream for School Based Health and Mental Health.

If it was not for these two individuals and other peer co-workers at other school sites; this employee may not have remained at Bassett Healthcare with the limitations in Psychiatric and Mental Health Support.
cons:
Bassett's expectations of their school based Mental Health LCSWS is to refer many cases out; resulting in a gap between effective "school based services," and the local County Mental Health Services.  The County system, though providing the best care they possess; are exceptionally limited in necessary resources.and, for purposes of not over extending themselves; Bassett as an organization is limited in offering the necessary pharmacology-psychiatric support).  Based on the lack of necessary Psychiatric Nurse Practioners and Board Certified Child Psychiatrists, Bassett is limited in offering the "Pharmacology-Psychotherapy approach for a variety of mental health conditions that plagues the school aged students they are serving.   For instance, the local community is compromised in health and mental health care.  Despite the qualifications and quality of care the local County provides; there is an enormous gap and compromise in services.

This writer and former employee of Bassett Health Care, previously held positions in the Human Services field that afforded a "Systems" or wrap around services approach that offered connecting to other systems of care in order to comprehensively meet the needs that presented themselves in more cases than not.  

Although Bassett is not directly responsible in a  neglectful manner; other workers that are employed as School Based Workers, and have a "Global View," would find themselves frustrated and limited in support from Bassett.

pros: I have worked here for nearly 10 years. Although it is a longer commute, it is worth it. We are treated with respect by administration. Our management is held accountable for the culture we are creating. I feel like we are a real team. It was not always that way, so this is a good thing. Our COO and president are truly wonderful and care about safety and quality and all of us.
cons:
Long commute and parking issues
Cafeteria needs renovation
Would like more educational opportunities in my  field

review_title: Can be a good place for professional enhancement, which will benefit the patients. Watch out for managers with agendas.
pros: Beautiful location. They'll support education sometimes.
cons: Low pay compared to other similar professions. Favoritism. Top leadership tries to improve but middle managers go unchecked. Politics interfere with staying focused on the mission. Big decisions are made without input from key stakeholders. For example, significant positions or assistants to programs are selected without input from the people responsible for the success of the programs.

review_title: Not a good place to work
job_title: Administrative Support Role in Cooperstown, NY
pros: There are some great caring people there.
cons:
Pay is low. Benefit costs go up every year, but with no raises, you’re actually making less each year. 

Top heavy in management who are well paid. Front line staff are low paid. Bassett cuts front line staff or doesn’t replace them. 
Patient Care suffers since front line staff does most of the work. 

HR does absolutely nothing with complaints. Bullying, harassment, favoritism, etc is allowed to go on. 
Many hourly staff not paid for lunch/dinner breaks that they cannot take due to lack of coverage, which is illegal.

pros: Clean lab, organized, lots of support from co workers, amicable work environment. Management is helpful and always open to assisting employees with any issues that may arise
cons: Employees here are extremely underpaid. Similar jobs at other facilities in this area make quite a bit more. There is very little room for job advancement, not very many oppurtunities for raises or moving up within the dept.

review_title: I'm sorry I took the job.
pros: Cooperstown is a charming town, there are many nice employees and if you like the rural life, it is a love community.
cons: Management (if you can call it that) is horrible!  In the OR, all management short of one are travelers and seeing no one knows how long they will stay, they get very little respect.  Due to that, they implement by mandate which makes no one happy which snow balls to an even poorer climate in the OR.  Compound that with very poor pay, poor benefits, and a poorly staffed OR leads to high stress and an unhappy OR community.

review_title: Not a bad company depending on where you work.
pros: Health insurance benefits are dirt cheap, atmosphere is somewhat relaxed, lots of perks of employment.
cons: Depending on the department you work in not all people share the "Bassett" values, while the heath insurance is cheap, you can only use their providers and it takes forever to get appointments and the location is often inconvenient depending on where you live. Pay is not great.

pros: Being a magnet teaching hospital, many valuable skills are learned entering your profession, that are useful throughout an entire career. The health insurance is also excellent.
cons: Some of the most underpaid staff in the area. at $10.00 starting as a surgical tech, it is difficult to make a lifelong profession at this hospital. That being said, a great place to learn your first couple years of experience.

pros: Low performance expectations leaves plenty of time to focus on your personal life.

VP's and middle managers whose first and only leadership experience is limited to Bassett makes for a plethora of operational issues.

pros: Excellent benefits and time off. COO truly cares about staff and patients, she is involved in everything that goes on in the organization. Main campus in Cooperstown is very home like and you get to know a lot of great people.

pros: Good team atmosphere, and you can tell the providers and other employees genuinely care about their patients.
